AdditionalFields.Value: Drug Development,Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Pediatric Cancer,Regulatory Science and Policy

Description: This exciting session will explore how real-world evidence (RWE) may be harnessed to inform and optimize pediatric cancer drug development and clinical trial design. Leading experts from academia and the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) will provide their unique perspectives as to how emerging data and evidence may guide translational and clinical pediatric cancer research efforts. Presentations will be followed by an interactive discussion between attendees and speakers to discuss the current state and future of pediatric cancer therapeutics, including how RWE aims to enhance clinical trial design, optimization, and implementation in pediatric populations.
SearchResultBody: DC11. Using Real World Evidence to Advance Pediatric Cancer Drug Development
Title: Using Real World Evidence to Advance Pediatric Cancer Drug Development
